thread.title: Local roundup: Black Wolves re-acquire Kevin Crowley
thread.title_full: Local roundup: Black Wolves re-acquire Kevin Crowley

author: The Bulletin
title: Local roundup: Black Wolves re-acquire Kevin Crowley
text: • H.S. roundup: Thames River gets back in win column MOHEGAN — The New England Black Wolves acquired Kevin Crowley from the Toronto Rock on Saturday, trading Dan Lintner, the Wolves’ top selection in last month’s draft, as well as a second-round pick in next year’s National Lacrosse League Draft. The trade is pending league approval. The deal reunites Crowley with the Black Wolves, who traded him to Toronto in March for forward Garrett Billings. Crowley, the only player to be drafted first in both professional lacrosse leagues, finished the regular season with 64 points (24 points, 39 assists). In five playoff games with the Rock, Crowley had five goals and seven assists. Lintner was selected eighth overall by the Wolves in the 2015 draft. WOMEN’S SOCCER ECSU 2 UMass-Boston 1 WILLIMANTIC — Woodstock Academy alum Emily Becher scored her team-leading 10th goal of the season to keep the Warriors unbeaten in Little East Conference play. Jamie Belden also scored and East Lyme graduate Rachel Skelton earned her eighth win of the season in goal for Eastern Connecticut State (8-3-1, 4-0-0). FIELD HOCKEY ECSU 3 Salem St. 2 MANSFIELD — Hannah Keiser scored in overtime, her second of the game, to lift the Warriors to victory. East Lyme alum Paige Schneider assisted on Keiser’s game-winner and Alex Kallgren scored the first goal for ECSU (7-4, 5-2 Little East). VOLLEYBALL Warriors split pair SPRINGFIELD, Mass. — Eastern split two matches at the Tom Hay Invitational, falling to Keene St., 3-0, before rallying to defeat Westfield St., 3-2. In the first match (25-15, 25-16, 25-22), Kay Mullen had a team-best seven kills and Fabiana Della-Monica dished out 15 assists. In the second match (19-25, 26-24, 22-25, 25-17, 15-8), Woodstock Academy alum Jackie Orlowski delivered four kills and Fitch alum Ashley adams added two for the Warriors (10-10). MEN’S SOCCER ECSU 2 UMass-Boston 1 BOSTON — Cooper D’Ambrosio scored in the final minute of regulation to give the Warriors the win. Tyler Jones scored the game-tying goal for Eastern (10-2-1, 3-0-1 Little East). Ryan Murphy made 10 stops in goal. By The Bulletin
